properties.description: This is the General Metadata Profile used and maintained by the Digital Scholarship Unit at the UTSC Library
A descriptive title for the item, either taken from the resource or supplied by the describer. Doesn’t need to be unique.
properties.title: Title

properties.description: If necessary, a secondary part of the item’s title goes here.
properties.title: Sub Title

properties.description: The name and role of an organization contributor to the item. Select a role from the MARC Code List for Relators that is available here: http://id.loc.gov/vocabulary/relators.html
properties.title: Role

properties.description: The description field allows for descriptive/contextual information about the item.
properties.title: Description

properties.description: Languages of the Work
properties.title: Languages

properties.description: Enter a three letter code following iso639-2b. The list is available here: https://www.loc.gov/standards/iso639-2/php/code_list.php
properties.title: Language

properties.description: A genre of the item, characterizing content with more specificity than <typeOfResource> Genre terms drawn from the aat https://www.getty.edu/research/tools/vocabularies/aat/index.html Use forms compatible with existing genres in the collection: https://digitalscholarship.utsc.utoronto.ca/browse/genre
properties.title: Genre

properties.description: The general content type of the item. This controlled list comes from the Mods Type of Resource List available here: https://www.loc.gov/standards/mods/userguide/typeofresource.html
properties.title: Type of Resource

properties.description: Enter text-based form of the date. The date of creation of the item; may be a range or uncertain date; formatted following RAD 1.4B5. http://www.cdncouncilarchives.ca/archdesrules.html
properties.title: Date Created (Text)

properties.description:
Enter date in the format YYYY-MM-DD.
Do not use any qualifiers or typographical symbols to express uncertainty. Express in ISO 8601 https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/ISO_8601
properties.title: Date Created (Start)

properties.description:
The ending point for the create date.
Enter the end date. Do not use any qualifiers or typographical symbols to express uncertainty. Express in ISO 8601.
https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/ISO_8601
properties.title: Date Created (End)

properties.description:
A date in which item is copyrighted.
Do not use any qualifiers or typographical symbols to express uncertainty. Express in ISO 8601.
https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/ISO_8601
properties.title: Copyright Date

properties.description: Name of an entity that published, released, etc. the item.
properties.title: Publisher

properties.description: Name of a Country associated with the items publication, production, etc drawn from the Marc Code List of Countries: https://www.loc.gov/marc/countries/
properties.title: Country

properties.description: Name of a Country associated with the items publication, production, etc in plain text
properties.title: Place

properties.description: A designation of a particular physical presentation of a resource, including the physical form or medium of material for a resource. This controlled vocabulary is taken from the marcsmd vocabulary here: https://www.loc.gov/standards/valuelist/marcsmd.html
properties.title: Form

properties.description: A statement of the number and specific material of the units of the resource that express physical extent. See additional information here: https://www.loc.gov/standards/mods/userguide/physicaldescription.html
properties.title: Extent

properties.description: Indicates an overall assessment of the physical quality of an electronic resource in relation to its intended use. Indicates an overall assessment of the physical quality of an electronic resource in relation to its intended use. We use this form to identify whether or not an object is suitable for creating as an AIP. If this value is anything but "preservation," this object requires maintenance before being archived.
properties.title: Reformatting Quality

properties.description: General textual information about the physical description of a resource.
properties.title: Note

properties.description: The method by which a resource achieved digital form. See additional information here: https://www.loc.gov/standards/mods/userguide/physicaldescription.html#digitalorigin
properties.title: Digital Origin

properties.description: Please use an official Internet Assigned Numbers Authority MIME type for the object. See additional information here: https://www.loc.gov/standards/mods/userguide/physicaldescription.html#internetmediatype
properties.title: Internet Media Type (MIME type)

properties.description: A term representing primary topic(s) on which the item focuses, that are not included in other subject fields. See additional information here: https://www.loc.gov/standards/mods/userguide/subject.html#topic
properties.title: Subject

properties.description: A term representing primary topic(s) on which the item focuses, that are not included in other subject fields. See additional information here: https://www.loc.gov/standards/mods/userguide/subject.html#topic
properties.title: Topic

properties.description: A term representing primary topic(s) on which the item focuses, that are not included in other subject fields. See additional information here: https://www.loc.gov/standards/mods/userguide/subject.html#topic

Used for geographic subject terms that are not appropriate for the <hierarchicalGeographic> element. See additional information here: https://www.loc.gov/standards/mods/userguide/subject.html#geographic
properties.title: Geographic

properties.description: Used for chronological subject terms or temporal coverage. Taken from a local authority.
properties.title: Temporal

properties.description: A name used as a subject. Only put personal names into this field. The name should be in the order it would regularly appear (‘First Name Last Name’ rather than, for example, ‘Last Name, First Name’)
properties.title: Name

properties.description: Includes all continents. E.g. Asia, Africa, Europe, North America, South America.
properties.title: Continent

properties.description: Name of a country, i.e. a political entity considered a country.
properties.title: Country

properties.description: Includes first order political divisions called states within a country, e.g. in U.S., Argentina, Italy. Use also for France département.
properties.title: State

properties.description: Includes first order political divisions called provinces within a country, e.g. in Canada China.
properties.title: Province

properties.description: Includes regions that have status as a jurisdiction, usually incorporating more than one first level jurisdiction.
properties.title: Region

properties.description: Name of the largest local administrative unit in various countries, e.g. England.
properties.title: County

properties.description: Name of a tract of land surrounded by water and smaller than a continent but is not itself a separate country.
properties.title: Island

properties.description: Name of an inhabited place incorporated as a city, town, etc.
properties.title: City

properties.description: Name of a smaller unit within a populated place, e.g., neighborhoods, parks, or streets.
properties.title: City Section

properties.description: One or more statements may be supplied. If one is supplied, it is a point (i.e., a single location); if two, it is a line; if more than two, it is an n-sided polygon where n=number of coordinates assigned. No three points should be co-linear, and coordinates should be supplied in polygon-traversal order.
properties.title: Coordinates

properties.default_value: Digital files found in the UTSC Library's Digital Collections are meant for research and private study used in compliance with copyright legislation. Access to digital images and text found on this website and the technical capacity to download or copy it does not imply permission to re-use. Prior written permission to publish, or otherwise use images and text found on the website must be obtained from the copyright holder. Please contact UTSC Library, Archives & Special Collections for further information.
properties.description: A statement on permitted use of the item.
properties.title: Rights

properties.description: This should be the item’s PID
properties.title: Identifier (PID)

properties.description: Use the reference code found in Discover Archives (https://discoverarchives.library.utoronto.ca/index.php/university-of-toronto-scarborough-library) for the file (collection). For items (objects), use the file (collection) reference code followed by a sequential number. The local identifier should include the collection/fonds number, series numbers, subseries number (if applicable), file number and item number. Omit the country and institution code (CA UTSC). This element is only used for items that are surrogates of UTSC-held physical items
properties.title: Identifier (local)

properties.description: General note about the work that does not fit anywhere else. Use sparingly.
properties.title: Note

properties.description: Language(s) of the item’s metadata “English name of language” (list is found here: https://www.loc.gov/standards/iso639-2/php/code_list.php)
properties.title: Language Term
